intro: Cryptolepis newii, commonly known as African bitter leaf, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces yellow, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
